bibl.title: The Last Queens of Egypt.
bibl.note: Introduction. - 1. Role models. - 2. Egypt and the Ptolemies. - 3. Cleopatra and her ancestors. - 4. Presentation to the Greeks: Hellenistic queens. - 5. Continuing the tradition: queens of Egypt. - 6. The royal cults: deification and amalgamation. - 7. The legacy of the Ptolemaic queens. - A selective family tree of the Ptolemaic queens. Bibliography and sources. Index.
bibl.seg: ASHTON Sally-Ann, The Last Queens of Egypt.
London, Pearson-Longman, 2003, 8°, xv-177 pp., 1 arbre généal., 29 figg., 1 carte. ISBN 0-582-77210-9. £19.99.

Introduction. - 1. Role models. - 2. Egypt and the Ptolemies. - 3. Cleopatra and her ancestors. - 4. Presentation to the Greeks: Hellenistic queens. - 5. Continuing the tradition: queens of Egypt. - 6. The royal cults: deification and amalgamation. - 7. The legacy of the Ptolemaic queens. - A selective family tree of the Ptolemaic queens. Bibliography and sources. Index.
